author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Government Bonds Fall on Wave of Supply
text:
U.S. government bonds fell Monday as investors were buffeted by three debt auctions representing the first part of nearly $300 billion of debt that the Treasury is selling this week.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note rose to 2.843% from 2.826% Friday, its first increase in three trading sessions. Yields rise as bond prices fall. The rise in yields was led by shorter-term securities, where most of the debt will be sold. The two-year note yield climbed to 2.279% from 2.262%.
